summary: BuildRequest specifies no explicit feature requirements (UI/UX upgrade only) but the diff adds/changes substantial application functionality, including new backend data models/APIs and multiple frontend modules for requests/chat/ratings/admin, which appear to go beyond a pure UI upgrade.

hallucinated_features.description: Added/expanded backend user profile system with roles and save/get profile APIs protected by authorization checks.
hallucinated_features.reason: BuildRequest lists no new functional requirements and explicitly frames the work as an already-implemented UI upgrade; this is new/expanded backend functionality rather than UI composition.

hallucinated_features.description: Added/expanded backend help-request domain models and request creation/management logic (e.g., RequestStatus, RequestWithTextTasks, requests map, nextRequestId, createRequest).
hallucinated_features.reason: BuildRequest contains no functional requirements and discourages new product features/models/APIs beyond UI/UX upgrades; this introduces/extends backend models and endpoints.

hallucinated_features.description: Introduced new chat functionality (hooks and UI panel) with polling, send/fetch/mark read/unread count behavior.
hallucinated_features.reason: Not requested in BuildRequest (Requirements: none) and constitutes a new workflow/feature area beyond UI upgrades.

hallucinated_features.description: Introduced ratings feature (rating dialog UI and ratings hooks).
hallucinated_features.reason: Not requested (Requirements: none) and adds a new product feature/workflow beyond UI/UX changes.

hallucinated_features.description: Introduced admin operations and analytics UI (admin hooks, analytics charts).
hallucinated_features.reason: Not requested (Requirements: none) and adds new admin feature surface beyond a UI-only upgrade.
